newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-S&P cuts Alcoa of Australia short term rating.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-S&P cuts Alcoa of Australia short term rating.

text.p: Standard and Poor's ratings agency said on Friday it had lowered the short term rating on Alcoa of Australia Limited to A-1 from A-1 positive, and affirmed the long term A-positive corporate credit rating.

The downgrade "reflects the imminent impact of an A$300 million capital reduction program on the company's finanical risk profile," S&P said in a statement, adding that Alcoa of Australia (AoA) had publicly indicated the programme was likely to be approved at an extraordinary meeting on March 6.
Alcoa of Australia is 60 percent owned by Aluminum Co of America and 39.25 percent by WMC Ltd.
"The corporate credit rating of AoA continues to reflect its market position as an extremely low cost producer of alumina and aluminium and the strong parentage of Alcoa," S&P said.
S&P said Alcoa's and WMC's long and short-term credit ratings were unaffected by the proposed capital reduction programme.
"The rating outlook is stable," S&P said, with AoA's business risk profile unaltered by the programme.
